0.user_question: Bruce works for 5 hours on Tuesday. On Wednesday he works twice the time he works on Tuesday. On Thursday he works 2 hours less than the time he works on Wednesday. How many hours does Bruce work in all these three days?

ost_step.1: Bruce worked for 5 hours on Tuesday.

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. Bruce worked for 5 hours on Tuesday. On Wednesday, since it’s double what he worked on Tuesday, we multiply this by 2 which equals 5*2=10 hours. Finally, because Bruce only spent one hour fewer working on Thursday compared to Wednesday (which was 10), Thursday would see him spend 10-2=8 hours working. Therefore, when adding up the amount of time across the entirety of those three days, you get together everything: 5+10+8 = 23 hours. The answer is: 23.

0.user_question: Bruce works for 5 hours on Tuesday. On Wednesday he works twice the time he works on Tuesday. On Thursday he works 2 hours less than the time he works on Wednesday. How many hours does Bruce work in all these three days?

direct_answer.text:
On Tuesday, Bruce worked for 5 hours.
On Wednesday, he worked twice as long as on Tuesday which means he worked for 5*2=10 hours.
And on Thursday, he worked 2 hours less than what he did on Wednesday so it equals (10-2)=8 hours.
In conclusion, across those three days, he totaled up working (5+10+8) or equal to 23 hours altogether!
The answer is: 23.
